intro: Wahlenbergia graminifolia, commonly known as the grassy bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils. Wahlenbergia graminifolia is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, showy flowers during the spring and summer months.
